interactions.comment:
And if anyone has a #VisionPro and can tell me if it works as well on #visionOS as it does on #iOS then I'd be keen to hear about it!
iOS
visionos
visionpro
@byjp yep, it works. Nice detail too.

@ellenich That is incredibly cool ???? Thank you so much for sending a video! And the detail is great to know about too.

I think I'll try to animate the card lifting up to flip next (so it doesn't sink through any table its on) ‚Äî and try to find a way to get my hands on a Vision Pro ????

@byjp not 100% sure if it's controllable, but it also seemed like the default orientation was off by 90¬∫? Like when it loads it's not ‚Äúfacing‚Äù me?

Could be just an issue with Quick Look in visionOS though?

@ellenich Oooh weird ‚Äî I have it oriented "Z up" (so it sits flat on a table, and the XY plane is the front), and different macOS systems seem to variously prefer Y-up and Z-up ‚Äî but your 90¬∫ off is in the wrong plane for that to be an issue. This is a screenshot from macOS QuickLook which implies it's the correct orientation, but there could easily be something I haven't configured. Thanks for sharing ‚Äî I'll keep reading up on USDZ!

@ellenich Out of interest, which side was "up" when you loaded it? It looks like it might have been the "back" (with the handwriting and address), where I put the model together expecting it to be the "front" (with TOLEDO). That might explain the 90¬∫ offset too (as the flip switches between landscape and portrait)

@edwellbrook It is! I'm loving it ???? One day I'll make a website that lets you compile one of these from scans, but for now there's just my CLI if you're feeling adventurous and want to make your own!
